info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 5:45PM MDT until July 21 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following county, eastern Sandoval.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.50 inches are expected over the area. The potential exists for flash flooding to develop. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santo Domingo Pueblo, Cochiti Pueblo, Cochiti Lake and Pena Blanca. - Canada Camada will be impacted by hazardous flows, as well as numerous other drainages flowing off the southeast slopes of the Jemez Mountains into Cochiti Lake and the Rio Grande. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING
